title: Best Procedure to Determine Moles of Gas

content.question: In another experiment, a small piece of <math alttext="M g, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is weighed, then placed in a flask containing excess <math alttext="1 molar H C l, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. The student wants to determine number of the moles of gas produced. Which of the following is the best way to conduct the experiment for accurate data collection?

choices.label: Conducting the experiment at different temperatures to see which generates the most gas
Completing the entire reaction in a large Erlenmeyer flask of known volume to measure the volume of the gas collected
Collecting the gas in a eudiometer tube and measuring the volume of the gas collected
Conducting the reaction in a graduated cylinder and measuring the volume of the gas collected

content.answer: Collecting the gas in a eudiometer tube and measuring the volume of the gas collected
